intro: Hoffmannseggella × raganii, commonly known as the hybrid hoffmannseggella, is a naturally occurring hybrid between Hoffmannseggella tenuifolia and Hoffmannseggella paludosicola. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. It exhibits intermediate morphological traits between its parent species, making it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to its hybrid nature, it is often found in specific ecological niches where its parent species overlap.
